I think you are looking at too narrow a range of values (-1 to 1). Try
expa=
nding the range to -8 to 8. I just threw a graph of the sig chart
overlaid =
on the poly chart between -2 and 2. There is a very close
match between the=
 two. But both look quite linear in that range. I've
also thrown a chart of=
 them overlaid between -30 and 30 and the chart
isn't nearly so linear.

--=
Shane

> Bah.. Couldn't get gcc to =
do it.  Oh well.  It's so little data, it  
> might have actually been slow=
er anyway.  SIMD is all about streaming  
> lots of data.  For one (or two)=
 vectors of data, it's usually not  
> worth it.  Now, if you were going to=
 queue up a large number of  
> evaluations, then you could see massive gai=
ns (potentially 2x to 4x).
>

omial.  Have you done

way I see it, it's

 a sigmoidal function!
